args.natural_language_statement: Let n be a natural number. Let f : (Fin n → ℝ) → ℝ and x0 : Fin n → ℝ. Suppose f is continuously differentiable in a neighborhood of x0: more precisely, assume that f has a Fréchet derivative at every point of some neighborhood of x0, and the map x ↦ fderiv ℝ f x is continuous at x0. Then f is differentiable at x0 (i.e., has a Fréchet derivative at x0). Formulate this using mathlib4 names: HasFderivAt, fderiv, continuous_at, and DifferentiableAt or HasFderivAt, and end the theorem with := by sorry. Use the filename jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2680.lean.

retrieved_examples.nl: If f has continuous Fréchet derivative in neighborhood then f is differentiable at x0
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem c1_implies_differentiable {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ℝ E] [FiniteDimensional ℝ E] (f : E → ℝ) (x0 : E) (s : Set E) (hs : IsOpen s) (hx0 : x0 ∈ s) (h : ∀ x ∈ s, HasFderivAt f (fderiv ℝ f x) x) (hc : ContinuousAt (fun x => fderiv ℝ f x) x0) : HasFderivAt f (fderiv ℝ f x0) x0 := by sorry

{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open scoped Classical
open NNReal Topology Filter

/-- Let n be a natural number. Let f : (Fin n → ℝ) → ℝ and x0 : Fin n → ℝ. Suppose f is continuously differentiable in a neighborhood of x0: more precisely, assume that f has a Fréchet derivative at every point of some neighborhood of x0, and the map x ↦ fderiv ℝ f x is continuous at x0. Then f is differentiable at x0 (i.e., has a Fréchet derivative at x0). Formul

args.content:
import Mathlib

theorem c1_implies_differentiable_at {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ℝ E] [FiniteDimensional ℝ E]
  {f : E → ℝ} {x0 : E} {s : Set E} (hs : IsOpen s) (hx0 : x0 ∈ s)
  (hf : ∀ x ∈ s, HasFDerivAt f (fderiv ℝ f x) x)
  (hcont : ContinuousAt (fun x => fderiv ℝ f x) x0) :
  HasFDerivAt f (fderiv ℝ f x0) x0 := by sorry
